intro: Tarenna eketensis var. situtela, commonly known as the Situtela tarenna, is a tropical shrub native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
